add_member_to_list.description: Add a new subscriber to an audience or update existing subscriber

props.name: email_address
props.description: Email address for the subscriber

props.name: status_if_new
props.description: Status for new subscribers

props.name: email_type
props.description: Type of email this member wants to receive

props.name: status
props.description: Current status of subscriber (for updates)

props.name: first_name
props.description: First name of the subscriber

props.name: last_name
props.description: Last name of the subscriber

props.name: language
props.description: Subscriber language (e.g., "en", "es", "fr")

props.name: vip
props.description: VIP status for subscriber

props.name: skip_merge_validation
props.description: Accept member data without merge field values even if required

add_note_to_subscriber.description: Add a note to a subscriber in your Mailchimp audience.

props.name: email
props.description: The email address of the subscriber to add a note to

props.name: note
props.description: The note content to add to the subscriber

add_subscriber_to_tag.description: Add a subscriber to a specific tag in your Mailchimp audience.

props.name: email
props.description: The email address of the subscriber to add to the tag

props.name: tag_name
props.description: The name of the tag to add the subscriber to

props.name: subscriber_hash
props.description: MD5 hash of the lowercase email address, email address, or contact_id

create_audience.description: Create a new audience (list) in your Mailchimp account

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the list

props.name: company
props.description: Company name for list contact information

props.name: address1
props.description: Street address for list contact information

props.name: address2
props.description: Additional address information (optional)

props.name: city
props.description: City for list contact information

props.name: state
props.description: State or province for list contact information

props.name: zip
props.description: ZIP or postal code for list contact information

props.name: country
props.description: Country for list contact information

props.name: phone
props.description: Phone number for list contact information (optional)

props.name: permission_reminder
props.description: The permission reminder for the list

props.name: from_name
props.description: Default from name for campaigns

props.name: from_email
props.description: Default from email address for campaigns

props.name: subject
props.description: Default subject line for campaigns

props.name: language
props.description: Default language for campaigns (e.g., "en", "es", "fr")

props.name: email_type_option
props.description: Whether the list supports multiple email formats (HTML/plain text)

props.name: use_archive_bar
props.description: Whether campaigns use the Archive Bar in archives by default

props.name: notify_on_subscribe
props.description: Email address to send subscribe notifications to (optional)

props.name: notify_on_unsubscribe
props.description: Email address to send unsubscribe notifications to (optional)

props.name: double_optin
props.description: Whether to require subscriber confirmation via email

props.name: marketing_permissions
props.description: Whether the list has marketing permissions (GDPR) enabled

props.name: campaign_type
props.description: The type of campaign to create

props.name: subject_line
props.description: The subject line for the campaign

props.name: title
props.description: The title of the campaign

props.name: from_name
props.description: The name that will appear in the "From" field

props.name: from_email
props.description: The email address that will appear in the "From" field

props.name: reply_to
props.description: The email address that will receive replies

props.name: to_name
props.description: The name that will appear in the "To" field (e.g., *|FNAME|*)

props.name: content_type
props.description: How the campaign content is put together

props.name: content_url
props.description: The URL where the campaign content is hosted (required if content_type is "url")

props.name: template_id
props.description: The ID of the template to use (required if content_type is "template")

props.name: html_content
props.description: The HTML content for the campaign (required if content_type is "html")

find_campaign.description: Search all campaigns for the specified query terms

props.name: query
props.description: Search terms to find campaigns

props.name: fields
props.description: Comma-separated list of fields to return

props.name: exclude_fields
props.description: Comma-separated list of fields to exclude

find_customer.description: Find a customer by email address in a store

props.name: email_address
props.description: Email address to search for

props.name: fields
props.description: Comma-separated list of fields to return

props.name: exclude_fields
props.description: Comma-separated list of fields to exclude

props.name: count
props.description: Number of records to return (max 1000)

props.name: offset
props.description: Number of records to skip for pagination

find_subscriber.description: Search for subscribers across all lists or within a specific list. This action provides comprehensive subscriber information including merge fields, interests, and activity data.

props.name: email
props.description: Email address of the subscriber to search for

props.name: include_fields
props.description: Fields to include in the response (leave empty for all fields). Use dot notation for nested fields (e.g., "merge_fields.FNAME")

props.name: exclude_fields
props.description: Fields to exclude from the response. Use dot notation for nested fields

find_tag.description: Search for tags on a list by name

props.name: name
props.description: Search query to filter tags (optional - if empty, returns all tags)

get_campaign_report.description: Get comprehensive report details for a specific sent campaign including opens, clicks, bounces, and performance metrics

props.name: fields
props.description: Comma-separated list of fields to return (e.g., "opens.unique_opens,clicks.click_rate")

props.name: exclude_fields
props.description: Comma-separated list of fields to exclude (e.g., "timeseries,_links")

remove_subscriber_from_tag.description: Remove a subscriber from a specific tag in your Mailchimp audience.

props.name: email
props.description: The email address of the subscriber to remove from the tag

props.name: tag_name
props.description: The name of the tag to remove the subscriber from

unsubscribe_email.description: Unsubscribe an email address from an audience

props.name: email_address
props.description: Email address to unsubscribe

props.name: skip_merge_validation
props.description: Accept member data without merge field values even if required

props.name: skip_duplicate_check
props.description: Ignore duplicates in the request

props.name: update_existing
props.description: Change existing members subscription status

update_member_in_list.description: Update a member in an existing Mailchimp audience (list)

props.name: email
props.description: Email of the new contact

email_opened.description: Fires when a recipient opens a an email in a specific campaign

link_clicked.description: Fires when a recipient clicks a specified link in a campaign

new_campaign.description: Fires when a new campaign is created or sent

new_customer.description: Fires when a new customer is added to a connected store

new_order.description: Fires when a new order is created in the connected store

new_segment_tag_subscriber.description: Fires when a subscriber joins a specific segment or tag

props.name: segment_id
props.description: The specific segment ID to monitor. Leave empty to monitor all segments.

props.name: tag_name
props.description: The specific tag name to monitor. Leave empty to monitor all tags.

subscribe.description: Fires when a new subscriber joins your Mailchimp audience. This trigger captures new subscriptions, opt-ins, and audience growth events with comprehensive subscriber information.

subscriber_updated.description: Fires when a subscriber profile is updated, including changes to merge fields, interests, or contact information. This trigger captures profile updates, new subscriptions, and subscriber modifications.

unsubscribe.description: Fires when a subscriber unsubscribes from your Mailchimp audience. This trigger captures unsubscribe events, opt-outs, and audience churn with comprehensive subscriber information for retention analysis.
